15.heading: Timeless Entertainment.
15.title: Ma Dalton [videorecording]
15.author: a production of Paloma Films and Reteitalia Production ; directed by Richard Schlesinger ; executive producer, Lucio Bompani ; written by Carl Sautter.
notes: Performers: Terence Hill, Nancy Morgan, Fritz Sperberg, Dominic Barto, Bo Gray, Radha Delamarter, Marc Mouchet, Neil Summers, Plabo Templeton, Ron Carey, Ruth Buzzi.
Based on Ma Dalton by Morris and Goscinny from the "Lucky Luke" comic books.
Television series (1993?) created by Lori Hill and Carl Sautter.

Summary (from OCLC): With the Dalton Brothers behind bars, Luke plans on getting a little rest. On returning to Daisy Town, Luke finds out that the outlaw's mother Ma Dalton has been robbing all the shopkeepers in the area. They have been letting her get away with her crimes because they know she is too proud to beg for charity. Luke and Ma Dalton becomes friends and Luke is more or less adopted by Ma. When Joe Dalton hears that his Ma has a new "son" he is furious and breaks out of prison with his brothers. Joe is chained to Bushwack, the "dumbest guard dog in the West" so every time Bushwack chases something Joe goes for a painful ride. Luke is caught between the Dalton boys and their Ma with the lovely Lotta wanting some of his attentions as well.

106.heading: Times.
106.title: "Branding Time"
106.author: [No author]
106.series: Cactus Canyon) p. 10-14 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Fact, v. 4, no. 6
notes: Begins: "Betsy Bell and her grandfather have found a temporary home on Cactus Canyon Ranch. When Loko, a bucking broncho, threw Betsy she had to spend six weeks in a wheel chair. To interest her, Uncle Mack, owner of the ranch, told her the story of Injun Joe's buried treasure. The Indian, as he lay dying, babbled something about burying a box containing treasure. He gave Uncle Mack a key and a faded code and map to the secret place."

182.title: Timeless Voyage : Earth Sky Connection
notes: Timeless Voyage : Earth Sky Connection / story, Appel Guery ; drawings, Sergio Macedo. -- Transtar Pacific, 1987. -- 99 p. : col. ill. ; 30 cm. -- Preface by J.-S. Marre ; introduction by I.J.P. Appel Guery ; "post-face" by S.M. (Sergio Macedo). -- Consists of a prefatory story, and five chapters. -- Genre: Science fiction. -- Call no.: PN6747.A6T513 1987

"Metamorphose Stellaire d'Ieros" p. 7-21 -- Summary: Ieros, Prince of Unity, reigns in the Intemporal Palace in the middle of the Permanence Lake. The universe sends Naraïna, queen of the fairies, with a message: Ieros is wanted by the stars as the magic center of a new alliance. Ieros takes off in his spaceship and it becomes the center of a new galaxy.

Chapter 1. "Contact Earth III" p. 24-35 -- Summary: The Earth 3 telepsychic intercommunication zone is blocked and investigation shows that it happens during the 12,000 years between the Atlantean Cataclysm and the beginning of the space age. The rules say to terminate the dimension but it is decided to intervene and attempt to normalize the human race.

Chapter 2. "Contact with Brains" p. 36-49 -- Summary: People around the Earth are invested with psychic powers to see if good mentality will spread through the population. However, some use the power for evil, and the bad as well as the good in humanity is strengthened.

Chapter 3. "The Birth of Yogan" p. 50-63 -- Summary: The watching powers cause a child to be born, and gradually give him extreme psychic powers. He begins to attract a following with his talk of vibratory dimensions and intemporal consciousness.

Chapter 4. "Community" p. 63-89 -- Summary: Yogan and his disciples achieve a higher consciousness and Yogan contacts the "great cosmic archetypes that rule the evolution of humanity." He makes alliances and returns to prepare the rest of humanity for the new consciousness. The "Priests of the Abyss" plan an attack. Yogan puts on a rock concert and light show that focuses the energy of thousands of people into a shield against evil. The Priests of the Abyss try again, alienating Yogan's community members and starting wars all over the globe.

Chapter 5. "Departure" p. 90-102 -- Summary: Cosmic vessels come to take away those who have purified themselves sufficiently. Earth then opens to release a giant spaceship in which the chosen humans are installed. Other humans will join them as their evolution is completed.

This summary is from European Comics in English Translation (Jefferson, NC : McFarland & Company, 2002). Used with permission.
